p: There are not many studies that report the in vitro and/or in vivo antitumor potential of black poplar extract. However, some research has been conducted on pure phytochemicals that can be found in the extracts of poplar buds. One of the most common components in Populus nigra L. is pinocembrin. This is a flavonoid found in high concentration in Populus nigra L. extracts. Additionally, for chrysine and pinobanksin-3-O-acetate significant values were signaled [ 55, 75].
